content:
I think I'll start by taking a "feelings journal" after each workout, like you suggested. I'll write down how I'm feeling, what I'm thinking, and any observations I have about my body and mind. I'm hoping that by doing this, I'll start to connect the dots between exercise and how it makes me feel, rather than just focusing on the physical aspects.

I'll also try to focus on the journey, rather than the destination. Instead of setting specific weight loss or muscle gain goals, I'll focus on how exercise is helping me feel more confident, energized, and focused. I want to celebrate small wins, like increasing my water intake or completing a challenging workout, rather than just focusing on the end result.

By shifting my mindset in this way, I hope to develop a more positive and sustainable relationship with exercise. I'm excited to see how this new approach will impact my motivation and overall well-being.
